alert.note: Alert for Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 28 at 9:25PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southeastern Montgomery, Shorter, Waugh, Tysonville, Mount Meigs, Cecil, Brassell and Cross Keys.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
